sub_title: Professor, Chair on Interpretation & Dispute Settlement in International Law at University of Groningen
summary: Specialties: Law of Treaties, Sources of International Law, Dispute Settlement, Law of the Sea, State responsibility, Environmental Law, Human Rights and Humanitarian Law, International Trade and Investment Law

school.name: Institute of Public International Law and International Relations - Summer School

awards.title: Laureate
awards.description:
Awarded a prestigious ERC Starting Grant of 1.5 million Euro, for a research project (TRCI-Law). 
TRICI-Law is a 5-year ERC Starting Grant project. Its aim is to demonstrate that that even in the case of customary international (CIL), i.e. an unwritten source of international law, there are rules of interpretation similar to those that exist for the interpretation of treaties, and to determine the content of these rules.
Prof. Panos Merkouris is the Principal Investigator (PI) of the project. 
More information about the nature, structure, objectives and the team of the TRICI-Law project can be found on our website (https://www.rug.nl/research/groningen-centre-for-law-and-governance/eu-projects/trici-law/).
